body:
>well they were filtering politics from all I think right

They're going to change that eventually. ([Here](https://ruqqus.com/+Ruqqus/post/5z28/why-was-it-decided-with-the/kpla), kek says it's temporary until the front page can efficiently show content from all categories. In the discord, he doesn't say when it will be changed.)

>since uncategorized could be politics they assume it is for the purposes of filtering, I assume

That's doesn't seem like a good decision though. You can't just censor a guild because "it could be politics". That would be ruining the chances of every guild with inactive moderators from gaining visibility. All this does is make it so you're only going to post in guilds with known active GMs. Guilds with inactive GMs are most likely going to stop growing because I don't think most users want their posts to be hidden from /all. The admins said that they could mark those guilds manually, but I don't expect them to do it for all of the hundreds of inactive guilds within a reasonable amount of time. (Some other users suggested letting the users mark guilds if the mods are inactive, and while that would work for guilds with inactive GMs but active posters, guilds with no active posters are basically quarantined.)

I'm still waiting for the admins to make that post.

<sup> - sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, **don't** censor my username]</sup>
body_html:
well they were filtering politics from all I think right

They're going to change that eventually. (Here, kek says it's temporary until the front page can efficiently show content from all categories. In the discord, he doesn't say when it will be changed.)

since uncategorized could be politics they assume it is for the purposes of filtering, I assume

That's doesn't seem like a good decision though. You can't just censor a guild because "it could be politics". That would be ruining the chances of every guild with inactive moderators from gaining visibility. All this does is make it so you're only going to post in guilds with known active GMs. Guilds with inactive GMs are most likely going to stop growing because I don't think most users want their posts to be hidden from /all. The admins said that they could mark those guilds manually, but I don't expect them to do it for all of the hundreds of inactive guilds within a reasonable amount of time. (Some other users suggested letting the users mark guilds if the mods are inactive, and while that would work for guilds with inactive GMs but active posters, guilds with no active posters are basically quarantined.)

I'm still waiting for the admins to make that post.

- sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, don't censor my username]
